diseases.name: diabetes
diseases.description:
Diabetes disease

Diabetes is a chronic (long-lasting) health condition that affects how your body turns food into energy. Most of the food you eat is broken down into sugar (also called glucose) and released into your bloodstream. When your blood sugar goes up, it signals your pancreas to release insulin.
symptoms: Urinate a lot, often at night
Have numb or tingling hands or feet.
solutions: Drink water as your primary beverage

diseases.name: highbloodpressure
diseases.description:
High blood pressure

high blood pressure is considered to be 140/90mmHg or higher (or 150/90mmHg or higher if you're over the age of 80) ideal blood pressure is usually considered to be between 90/60mmHg and 120/80mmHg.
solutions: Lose extra pounds and watch your waistline
Limit the amount of alcohol you drink
